title: Night Sky Camping: Pointing at the Milky Way
caption: Two campers sit by a lit tent and small fire, admiring a star-filled sky.

reading.passage: Evidence-based description is a core academic skill. When describing a photo or a scene, strong speakers separate observation from interpretation. Observation focuses on what can be verified directly from the image, while interpretation uses cautious language to propose what might be happening.

questions.explanation: 'It appears that' is a hedging phrase that keeps your description evidence-based.

listening.note: Read this as a script and practice note-taking.
listening.script: Today we will practice describing a photo. First, list what you can see. Second, explain what it might mean. Finally, connect it to a broader idea.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Camping Under the Stars'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Camping Under the Stars' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Camping Under the Stars' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Camping Under the Stars'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Camping Under the Stars'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Camping Under the Stars', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Camping Under the Stars' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).

model.en: The photo shows night sky camping: pointing at the milky way with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال Sitting and looking at the stars هستند.
در Night campsite Tent (orange) و Campfire glow دیده می‌شود.
فضا Amazed به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself at Night campsite. Two campers sit by a lit tent and small fire, admiring a star-filled sky. At first, I noticed Tent (orange), Campfire glow, Starry sky / Milky Way and the way people were sitting and looking at the stars. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Warm jackets, Outdoor pants) and their expressions made the scene feel amazed, peaceful, curious. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Night campsite بودم. Two campers sit by a lit tent and small fire, admiring a star-filled sky. اول Tent (orange)، Campfire glow و Starry sky / Milky Way را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Sitting and looking at the stars. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Warm jackets و Outdoor pants) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Amazed، Peaceful و Curious به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, they sat and looking at the stars.
Then, they checked Tent (orange) and continued.
Finally, they felt Amazed about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، They sat and looking at the stars.
بعد، They Tent (orange) را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Amazed بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as Tent (orange), Campfire glow, Starry sky / Milky Way are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like pointing toward the sky can signal feelings such as amazed, peaceful, curious. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل Tent (orange)، Campfire glow و Starry sky / Milky Way فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Pointing toward the sky چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Amazed، Peaceful و Curious را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: They have already handled similar situations before.
They have learned to stay Amazed in Night campsite.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: They قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
They یاد گرفته است در Night campsite Amazed بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment at Night campsite, one small change could create a big problem. If Tent (orange), Campfire glow had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Night campsite دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر Tent (orange) و Campfire glow نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If they had checked Tent (orange) earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Amazed.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر They زودتر Tent (orange) را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Amazed بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
